intro: Chrysanthemum jucundum, commonly known as the happy chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage is dark green and finely serrated, adding ornamental value to gardens. Chrysanthemum jucundum is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and is used in traditional Chinese medicine.
